info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 22 at 7:01AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Cabarrus, Catawba, western Davie, Alexander, Lincoln, Iredell, Mecklenburg, western Rowan, Gaston, northwestern Union and northeastern York Counties through 730 AM EDT... At 701 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles northeast of Boomer to 9 miles northeast of Newton to 6 miles north of Lincolnton. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Gastonia, Uptown Charlotte, Huntersville, Kannapolis, Downtown Concord, Statesville, Newton, Lincolnton, Mocksville and Taylorsville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
